bug.short_desc: double click stops on ":" char with 0.6.90-1.fc24
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: When selecting text by double click, it stops on ":" char with 0.6.90-1.fc24
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): xfce4-terminal-0.6.90-1.fc24.x86_64 It works in xfce4-terminal-0.6.3-9.fc24.x86_64
How reproducible: always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. # echo "http://example.com" 2. Double click on "example"
Actual results: "example.com" is selected
Expected results: "http://example.com" should be selected

Would you be willing to file this upstream at bugzilla.xfce.org ?
Or would you like me to do so?

From upstream BZ:
(In reply to Igor from comment #3) > 0.6.91 has been released: > http://archive.xfce.org/src/apps/xfce4-terminal/0.6/xfce4-terminal-0.6.91. > tar.bz2 > It contains the fix.

I also see double-click selection broken in F-24 XFCE but I am not sure it is the same bug. Could be this Bug backported first? /var/log/messages: /usr/libexec/gdm-x-session: (xfce4-terminal:3479): Vte-WARNING **: (vtegtk.cc:1739):int vte_terminal_match_add_gregex(VteTerminal*, GRegex*, GRegexMatchFlags): runtime check failed: (g_regex_get_compile_flags(gregex) & G_REGEX_MULTILINE)

(In reply to Jan Kratochvil from comment #4) > I also see double-click selection broken in F-24 XFCE but I am not sure it > is the same bug.
I think it is. However I am seeing some other issues with 0.6.91, so I don't want to push that until they are sorted out.
> Could be this Bug backported first? > /var/log/messages: > /usr/libexec/gdm-x-session: (xfce4-terminal:3479): Vte-WARNING **: > (vtegtk.cc:1739):int vte_terminal_match_add_gregex(VteTerminal*, GRegex*, > GRegexMatchFlags): runtime check failed: (g_regex_get_compile_flags(gregex) > & G_REGEX_MULTILINE)
Can you report that one upstream?

(In reply to Kevin Fenzi from comment #5) > Can you report that one upstream?
Filed: https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=770718
I meant bugzilla.xfce.org... unless you think this is a vte291 bug somehow?

Can you test this scratch build of 0.6.91 and see if:
a) it solves this bug
and
b) if there's any oddities you see in window sizes or --geometry WxH
https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=15473669

(In reply to Kevin Fenzi from comment #9) > a) it solves this bug
Yes, it fixed the double-click selection, thanks.
> b) if there's any oddities you see in window sizes or --geometry WxH
I do not see anything but I haven't really tested this one. I could reboot the host to see whether all the windows restore correctly but I do not like doing all the system state recovery after a reboot, ping me if you really need that.
